data.name: Education and student services - Medical sciences area
Management of national, EU and international research programmes office
data.description:
L’ufficio fornisce supporto, anche attraverso un servizio di project management specialistico, in tutte le fasi di gestione dei progetti di ricerca finanziati - a livello locale, nazionale, europeo ed internazionale - che vanno dall’avvio, alla gestione, al monitoraggio, alla rendicontazione e alle procedure di audit.

In collaborazione con l’Ufficio Valorizzazione e Impatto della Ricerca, si occupa della gestione di programmi e di progetti volti alla valorizzazione dei risultati della ricerca.

In collaborazione con la Divisione Relazioni Internazionali, contribuisce alla gestione di progetti di cooperazione e mobilità internazionale.

In collaborazione con l’Ufficio Etica e Integrità della Ricerca, fornisce supporto alla Divisione Pianificazione per l’attribuzione dei finanziamenti interni alla ricerca e per la gestione dei progetti finanziati su bandi di Ateneo.

data.name: Centre Agriculture Food Environment - C3A
data.description:
The Centre Agriculture Food Environment was born out of a joint UNITN-FEM initiative with the aim of carrying out scientific research and instruction in the fields of agriculture, food and the environment.

Operating as a research university, the Centre Agriculture Food Environment covers the entire didactic cycle in the environmental and agri-food sciences and encourages the integration of quality and insightful scientific research and instruction into the intensive agriculture field by focusing on quality food products and the reduction of the environmental impact of agricultural practices and a sustainable use of environmental resources.
data.address: Via Edmund Mach, 1, 38010 San Michele All'adige TN

data.name: Estates Directorate
data.description:
The Real Estate and Procurement Directorate oversees the construction of new buildings and all architectural, maintenance and technical aspects.

It drafts and updates the Building plan, which lays down the University’s functional and dimensional requirements and establishes its priorities.

The Directorate works with the divisions and offices it supervises:

  • Buildings Management
  • Logistics Services
  • Property Development
  • Prevention and Protection Service

to monitor the procedures  concerning planned construction works and preliminary tendering procedures for new works and supply contracts.
It coordinates the project management of buildings under construction and provides assistance with their acceptance.
Provides the departments and centers with appropriate management, administrative and technical procedures for a wide range of tasks.

The Directorate presents all the University’s projects and their motivation to the conference of services of the Autonomous Province of Trento.

The Real Estate and Procurement Directorate coordinates and promotes the University’s prevention and protection policy, to ensure compliance with all safety regulations.

In synergy with the Provincial Healthcare Service (APSS), it helps draft agreements for the development of new research areas in the health and medical sector.

data.name: Research ethics and integrity office
data.description:
The office oversees the drafting and implementation of the University’s policies and procedures on research ethics and integrity, the processing and protection of data in research projects, gender equality, public engagement.

In collaboration with the Division for the Valorization and Impact of Research and the Directorate of Communication and External Relations, the office coordinates and supports public engagement e Citizens Science activities.

It also coordinates the activities of the Research Ethics Committee through a dedicated office.

data.name: Directorate of Research Services and Valorization
data.description:
The Directorate oversees all the activities supporting scientific research within the University, from the planning of the activities to their implementation, to the exploitation of results.

It provides assistance with the promotion and valorization of research outputs, including activities inspired by the principles of Open Science, providing advice and training on copyright issues and on strategies for publishing and disseminating research results.

The Directorate also monitors the activities in the area of research ethics and integrity, as well as those in the area of research quality and the evaluation of research outputs.

data.name: Dissemination and Evaluation of Research Outputs Division
data.description:
The Division designs and manages digital services and University databases for the collection, documentation, conservation, dissemination, promotion and monitoring of research outputs.

It provides support in the definition and implementation of University policies and procedures for Open Science and University publishing.

data.name: Research Support Division
data.description:
The division helps define, implement and coordinate the activities required to support research, and helps promote the talent of researchers and their career. It also contributes to the identification and management of processes ensuring quality in research and third mission.

The division helps researchers draft and submit individual and partnership proposals to participate in national, European and international calls, and provides assistance with the interpretation of the management and accounting regulations as well as in the definition of contracts with funding organizations during the negotiation phase.

The division oversees the drafting and implementation of the University’s policies and procedures on research ethics and integrity and the processing and protection of data in research projects, and is responsible for the office of the Research Ethics Committee.

The activities are carried out by two offices:

  • The Research ethics and integrity office, and
  • the Research support office, which is organized in three units, one for each campus, in Trento, Povo-Mesiano, and Rovereto.

data.name: Legal services, Partnerships, Corruption Prevention
data.description:
The legal services office deals with a wide range of legal matters on behalf of the University, providing assistance in preparation for and during legal proceedings and overseeing the work of external consulting firms. It provides legal advice.
It coordinates and gives legal support on all that concerns personal data protection and security, the right to access public documents and self-certification. It is responsible for the University’s legal requirements, in particular in the area of transparency and anti-corruption policies.
Is in charge of the implementation of the Three-year programme for transparency and integrity and of the regulation on transparency. It monitors and implements the anti-corruption policies laid down in the Three-year plan for corruption prevention.

It establishes the procedures for citizens’ access to University documents and the University register, and provides technical and legal support in relationships between the University and partner organizations.

data.name: Research Outputs Office
data.description:
L’ufficio si occupa della gestione degli archivi e dei sistemi informativi di Ateneo dedicati alla raccolta, alla documentazione, alla conservazione e alla disseminazione della produzione scientifica. In particolare, in tali sistemi è incluso l’archivio IRIS dei prodotti della ricerca e delle tesi di dottorato. Quest’ultimo costituisce il punto unico di inserimento delle informazioni strategiche per tutti i processi interni ed esterni della ricerca inclusi quelli per la valutazione e il monitoraggio della ricerca (VQR, ASN, PRIN, accreditamento dottorati, progressioni e scatti stipendiali, prodotti della ricerca finanziata dalla UE e altri adempimenti in merito agli obblighi di pubblicazione ad accesso aperto, ecc.).

Fornisce supporto alla definizione e all’implementazione delle politiche e delle procedure di Ateneo per la Scienza Aperta e per il diritto d'autore, anche attraverso campagne informative al personale docente e ricercatore.

Si occupa inoltre del coordinamento del personale preposto allo svolgimento delle attività di supporto e verifica dei contenuti inseriti dagli autori nei diversi archivi di Ateneo, con particolare riferimento alla verifica delle scelte degli autori in merito alle policy di accesso ai prodotti depositati in archivio.

data.name: Office of the Directorate of Research Services and Valorization
Systems Management, HPC and Data Center
Committee for the Implementation of the Code of Ethics
data.description: The Committe of the Senate for the implementation of the Ethic Code is a consultive body. Upon request of the Academic Senate, it submits opinions and recommendations on their areas of competence.

data.name: Center for Mind/Brain Sciences-CIMeC - Council
data.description:
The Council of the Department is the main governing body of the Department.
It comprises all the professors of the Department and representatives of students, detailed below, PhD students, research fellows and researchers, in accordance with the procedures defined in the Department regulation.

data.name: The University Animal Welfare Committee (OPBA)
data.description: The Body for the Protection of Animals (OPBA) deals with topics regarding animals used for scientific and educational purposes, in all facilities of the University which carry out scientific activity using animals, as per Legislative Decree no. 26/2014.

data.name: Board of Discipline
data.description: The Board of Discipline carries out the preliminary phase of the disciplinary legal proceedings concerning professors and researchers, which foresee more serious sanctions than censure, and expresses an opinion which is submitted to the Council of Administration.

data.name: Director General
data.description: The Director General, in the frame of the areas approved by the Council of Administration, is responsible for the overall running and organisation of the offices and services, the technical-administrative staff of the University and the technical resources.

data.name: Humanities - Department Council
data.description:
The Council of the Department is the main governing body of the Department.
It comprises all the professors of the Department and representatives of students , detailed below, PhD students, research fellows and researchers, in accordance with the procedures defined in the Department regulation.

data.description:
The Council of the School is the main governing body of the School.
It comprises all the professors of the School and representatives of students , detailed below, PhD students, research fellows and researchers, in accordance with the procedures defined in the Department School regulation.

data.name: President
data.description: The President of the Board of Directors guarantees the special autonomy the University avails of.

data.name: Committee of Technical and Administrative Staff
data.description: The administrative and technical staff council advises on the steps to be taken concerning the policies of organization, management and training of the technical and administrative staff and of language teachers of the University.

data.name: Committee of PhD Candidates and Research Fellowship Holders
data.description: The Committee of Phd students and grant holders is a collective body with an advisory capacity in the field of organizational, maagerial and educational policies of Phds and grant holders.

data.name: Central Management
data.description:
Al vertice della struttura amministrativa si colloca la Direzione Generale, in rapporto di dipendenza politica dal Rettore, che indirizza e coordina i servizi tecnico-amministrativi a supporto delle attività istituzionali di Ateneo.
A supporto del Direttore Generale vi è un organismo composto dai dirigenti di primo livello, denominato Board, presieduto dal Direttore Generale e con funzioni consultive.
Attraverso le divisioni e gli uffici che direttamente dipendono da essa, la Direzione Generale assolve le seguenti funzioni:

  • definizione, in linea con il piano strategico di Ateneo, del piano pluriennale di sviluppo e miglioramento della qualità dei servizi tecnico-amministrativi di supporto alle attività istituzionali di Ateneo e rendicontazione annuale sullo stato della sua attuazione
  • collegamento e integrazione con gli Organi di Governo dell’Ateneo
  • coordinamento funzioni di supporto a Presidente del CdA, Rettore e Direttore Generale
  • coordinamento delle Direzioni
  • adozione degli atti relativi all’organizzazione degli uffici e all’attribuzione di incarichi e responsabilità ai dirigenti, d’intesa con il Rettore ed in attuazione dei piani generali di organizzazione approvati dal Consiglio di Amministrazione
  • attuazione dei piani, programmi e direttive generali definite dal Rettore, dal Consiglio di Amministrazione e dagli organi accademici
  • gestione degli adempimenti connessi con la stesura del Piano integrato di attività e organizzazione (PIAO) e della Relazione sulla performance
  • rapporti con le istituzioni
  • definizione dei piani strategici di comunicazione e gestione delle relative iniziative
  • assistenza nella risoluzione di problematiche legali, consulenza legale e rilascio pareri e indicazioni di tipo tecnico giuridico alle strutture dell’Amministrazione centrale e dell’Ateneo 
  • gestione dell’attività amministrativa e di segreteria degli Organi di governo dell’Ateneo (Consiglio di Amministrazione, Senato Accademico, ecc.)
  • raccolta dati ed elaborazioni per gli Organi di Governo e per le attività di programmazione di Ateneo
  • presidio delle funzioni riguardanti la trasparenza, l’anticorruzione e la protezione dei dati personali
  • applicazione e gestione del sistema di valutazione e assicurazione interna della Qualità di Ateneo 
  • gestione del patrimonio informativo
  • monitoraggio e sviluppo dei rapporti dell’Università con i soggetti esterni
  • gestione dei rapporti con le società partecipate, riguardo agli aspetti finanziari, contabili e organizzativi delle stesse
  • promozione di iniziative ed eventi volti a favorire l’equità e la valorizzazione di tutte le diversità presenti all’interno della realtà dell’Ateneo
  • gestione, a supporto degli Organi di Governo e dei Centri di Responsabilità, dei processi di pianificazione e controllo di gestione
  • verifica del corretto svolgimento dei processi contabili previsionali e di consuntivazione
  • elaborazione del Bilancio di Ateneo
  • gestione finanza
  • gestione dei rapporti con gli enti finanziatori e gli organi di controllo esterni (Collegio dei Revisori dei conti, Nucleo di Valutazione, auditors esterni) in coordinamento con la Direzione Servizi alla Ricerca e Valorizzazione
  • gestione degli adempimenti connessi con: l’Atto di indirizzo con la Provincia Autonoma di Trento; l’intesa con la Fondazione Cassa di Risparmio di Trento e Rovereto ed altri finanziatori minori; le specifiche richieste del MUR; il patto di stabilità e altri adempimenti legati al concorso dell’ateneo agli obiettivi di finanza pubblica

data.name: Rectorate
data.description: The activities of this office involve institutional relations and assistance to the Rector, the Vice-Rectors and Rector’s delegates.

data.name: Rectorate
data.description: The activities of this office involve institutional relations and assistance to the Rector, the Vice-Rectors and Rector’s delegates.

data.name: Rectorate
data.description: The activities of this office involve institutional relations and assistance to the Rector, the Vice-Rectors and Rector’s delegates.

data.name: Teaching and Research Quality Assurance
data.description:
It supports the Quality Assurance Committee (PQA) in defining the procedures for the implementation of quality assurance policies in education, research, third mission, based on the suggestions of the University’s governing bodies.

It coordinates all activities in the area of quality assurance (management of SUA CdS and SUA Rd databases, periodical review and monitoring activities) and provides support to university services responsible for carrying them out.

It designs and implements common instruments for QA procedures, like guidelines and training sessions, both online and in class.

It is responsible for disseminating information on quality assurance matters among interested parties and the Evaluation Group.

data.name: Technical Support and Relations with the Educational System
Committee for Recruitment and Career Advancement
data.description: The Committee for Recruitment and Career Advancement aims to implement quality procedures for the recruitment and career advancement of academic and research staff.

data.name: Administration and Accounting Services - Povo
data.description:
The Administration and Accounting Service for Povo-Mesiano offers its services to the departments and centers based in Povo-Mesiano.
The service:

  • supports the Planning Division, in collaboration with the directors of departments and centers, in planning and programming activities for the relevant units
  • is responsible for (general/analytic, vendors/clients) accounting for its units, including all that is required for drawing up the balance sheet (amendments and corrections included)
  • serves as a liaison office for the Administration Division for tax requirements and support to external auditors
  • manages supply procedures and contracts below the EU threshold
  • issues invoices and monitors credits
  • manages cash reserves for the relevant units
  • is responsible for paying suppliers of goods and services, reimbursing expenses for missions, other compensations
  • supports teaching and research staff in accounting matters, contracts, various procedures
  • provides its support in selection procedures in the areas of teaching and research and oversees contracts in collaboration with the Human Resources and Organization Directorate
  • drafts and organizes contracts

data.name: Information Engineering and Computer Science - Laboratory Technicians
Information Engineering and Computer Science - Department Staff
Council of Directors
data.description: The Council of Directors is the body that acts as the link among the academic structures, and between the latter and the Academic Senate. Its members consist of the Directors of the different Departments and Centres. It is chaired by the Rector.

data.name: Human Resources and Organization
data.description:
The Human Resources and Organization Directorate, with the divisions and offices it supervises, oversees the management of the University’s human resources , is responsible for paying staff and social security contributions, and monitors staffing requirements and related costs.

The directorate implements policies and programmes for the development of technical and administrative staff, including training and recruitment plans, a staff evaluation exercise and incentives systems.

On request from the University’s management, it is responsible for implementing organizational development strategies and establishing welfare and organizational well-being policies.

It is in charge of updating internal regulations and is responsible for relations with trade unions and for drafting and updating the University’s collective agreement.
The directorate also welcomes newly appointed staff and oversees the service responsible for managing access to university buildings.

It also offers consulting services to grant holders, and provides a welcome service to high school students who participate in the “Alternanza scuola lavoro” project at the University.

The directorate provides its support to the Centro Studi Martino Martini.

Finally, it serves as a coordinator for its dependent offices and divisions:

  • The Employee Relations Division - Academic and Teaching Staff
  • The Employee Relations and Payroll Division - Technical and Administrative Staff, which recruitment procedures and contracts for technical and administrative staff and language experts. The division ensures the proper implementation of labour law, the national collective agreement, the University Collective Agreement and other provisions.
  • The HR Development and Organization Division, which is responsible for evaluating staff performance, establishing training requirements, overseeing internal mobility, and conducting surveys on organizational wellbeing and the quality of services.
  • The Relations with Trade Unions Office.

data.name: Property and Real Estate Division
data.description:
The Property and Real Estate Division is responsible for property estimates, compulsory acquisitions and tenancy agreements, and coordinates office and furniture moves. 

It is also in charge of guestrooms, contracts for janitorial services, the security service, and the University’s fleet of vehicles. In the performance of its tasks, the division works closely with the heads of the Building management divisions in Trento, Rovereto and Povo-Mesiano.

The division advises on the purchase of furniture and equipment, and offers a maintenance service.
It is responsible for general services (deliveries, vending machines, photocopiers) and for their proper functioning.

The Estates and Facilities, together with the Planning, Administration and Finance Directorate, manages property insurance.

data.name: Prevention and Protection Service
data.description:
The Prevention and Protection Service submits to the Rector guidelines and strategies on Health and Safety at Work.
It identifies and implements safety procedures and examines risk factors to formulate risk assessments. Based on these assessments, it proposes appropriate preventive and protective measures and suggests risk monitoring systems.

It falls within the responsibilities of the service to inform University staff and students on prevention measures and to improve safety culture.

The Prevention and Protection Service, together with APSS, is responsible for staff training on health issues.
It is in charge of implementing regulations in force on matters of health and safety at work and preventive and protective measures.

data.name: Education and Student Services - Science and technology area
Student Support Service: Psychology and Cognitive Science, Mind and Brain Centre
International Mobility Staff - Cognitive Science Area
Technical support and Relations with schools
Civil, Environmental and Mechanical Engineering - Department Staff
Sociology and Social Research - Department Staff
Science and Technology Area - PhD Office
data.description:
The division supports the work of academic departments and centres in the science and technology area, in particular as regards:

  • writing proposals to establish and renew doctoral courses, annual reports, courses regulations, and maintaining relationships with institutional partners;
  • establishing collaboration and funding agreements to offer study courses;
  • preparing calls for admissions, managing applications online, dealing with selection procedures;
  • improving the international appeal of the doctoral programme and increasing student mobility through agreements for joint thesis research, international mobility programmes, support to foreign students/PhD students, support to evaluation committees that have to assess foreign qualifications;
  • accounting procedures in compliance with national regulations, elaboration and analysis of statistical data.

The division also oversees the academic progress of PhD students up to their thesis defense, and is responsible for other qualifying exams (esami di Stato) that the University offers.

data.name: Education and Student Services - Science and Technology Area
data.description:
Through its subunits, the office defines the university courses for departments and centres, oversees students matters for first and second level courses (admissions, careers, exam certificates, graduations), is responsible for quality assurance, the publication of notices on Esse3, lecture arrangements.

The office also oversees international mobility programmes, helping foreign students and PhD students on their arrival and during their stay, it drafts international mobility agreements and takes part in negotiations for this purpose, publishes calls and designates the members of selection committees. It participates in international promotion campaigns.

data.name: Student Support Service: Economics, Law and International Studies
Education and Student Services - Cognitive Science Area
data.description:
Through its subunits, the office defines the university courses for departments and centres, oversees students matters for first and second level courses (admissions, careers, exam certificates, graduations), is responsible for quality assurance, the publication of notices on Esse3, lecture arrangements.

The office also oversees international mobility programmes, helping foreign students and PhD students on their arrival and during their stay, it drafts international mobility agreements and takes part in negotiations for this purpose, publishes calls and designates the members of selection committees. It participates in international promotion campaigns.

data.name: Library Committee
data.description: The library council decides on the general guidelines and determines the planning aims of the University library.

data.name: Board of Auditors
data.description: The Board of Auditors checks the accounting-administration of the University and monitors that the principles of correct administration and of the regulations in force are respected.

data.name: Academic Senate
data.description: The Academic Senate is the body that governs scientific production and teaching at the University. It cooperates with the Rector in the targeting, planning and coordination of teaching and research activities at the University. Moreover, taking into consideration the proposals of the individual areas of the University, it collaborates with the Rector in determining the scientific and teaching plans and their fulfilment, the allocation of resources and the recruitment of professors and researchers.

data.name: Student Council
data.description: The Student Council is the body that represents the students attending the different courses at the University.

data.name: Technicians - Hydraulics and Soil Defence Laboratory
Technicians - Materials and Structures Testing Laboratory
Support to Evaluation and Quality Assurance
data.description: The division supports the University’s governing bodies in the collection, use and processing of data for evaluation and planning activities and in the implementation and management of Quality Assurance processes.

data.name: BUD - University Digital Library
data.description:
The e-library division manages the library’s electronic resources: databases, e-books and electronic periodicals.

In particular, it collaborates with the Acquisitions and Contracts Division to evaluate and select new resources, it monitors bibliographic management operations and the development of applications, maintains relations with digital service suppliers, manages the helpdesk.

Through the website and other media, the division also informs users and provides training on the library’s services and resources.

It constantly monitors and stays up to date with new technological trends and opportunities offered by the market in the area of library services.

data.name: Library - Acquisitions and Contracts Division
data.description:
The Acquisitions and Contracts Division is responsible for selecting the suppliers of goods and services for the University Library System.

The division, in particular, is in charge of the acquisition process, from the choice of publications in collaboration with the departments to the drawing up of contracts; is oversees bibliographic and administrative management operations as regards books and paper periodicals, and is responsible for their addition to and cataloguing in the Catalogo Bibliografico Trentino and other catalogues.

data.name: Employee Relations Division - Academic and Teaching Staff
data.description:
The Employee Relations Division - Academic and Teaching Staff organizes and oversees the recruitment procedures of teaching and research staff, and awards teaching and research contracts to professors from Italian and foreign universities.

It manages career development matters (salary increases, study and research leave, leaves of absence, sick leave, retirements), in compliance with labour law, and drafts regulations, directives and explanatory notes in its areas of competence.

The division reviews the procedures authorizing teaching staff to perform other work beside their university assignments, and prepares individual contracts below the Community threshold for other university units and divisions. It maintains the “Anagrafe delle prestazioni” database, and is in charge of relations with INAIL and Agenzia del Lavoro.

data.name: Administration Division
data.description:
The Administration Division supports the Planning, Administration and Finance Directorate in its control functions as concerns the voluntary review of the final budget and the monitoring of the financial rating.

It plans cash flows, manages available funds (management and monitoring of earnings, payments, bank reports, mortgages, credit cards, reminders) and is responsible for accounting for the Central Management, support documents for vendor payments, missions, scholarships and other compensations.
Manages cash reserves and credit card payments.

data.name: Planning Division
data.description:
The Planning Division helps the Planning, Administration and Finance Directorate with the strategic plan and the multi-year operating plans.
It is in charge of relations with the departments and centers for the drawing up of the annual and multiannual budget.

It monitors the budget on an ongoing basis based on the University’s financial position, financial performance and cash flows.
Provides its support in these matters, including through appropriate management reports. It monitors the evolution of staff expenditure and State revenue.

The Planning Division drafts the preliminary balance sheet and monitors the current budget.

data.name: Purchasing Directorate
data.description:
The mission of the Purchasing Directorate is to serve as a central office for the University's purchases through accurate planning and the optimization of the entire procurement process of all goods and services. The directorate oversees the legal and procedural correctness of above and below threshold tendering procedures for goods and services, negotiated procedures and the direct award of contracts.

In particular, the Directorate:

  • plans the purchasing requirements of departments and centres and develops a University plan for supplies and services, in order to sign contracts in the general interest of the University including by defining a sustainable procurement system;
  • plans the purchases and defines tendering procedures that can meet the needs of departments and centres and the strategic, procedural and affordability objectives of the University;
  • coordinates and supports University departments and centres and the procurement officers (Responsabile Unico del Procedimento - RUP) for the implementation of the special framework for procurement and the rationalization of expenditure;
  • manages the procurement procedures for public works, supplies and services, through monitoring activities as well as contracts and framework agreements;
  • supports and coordinats the procedures concerning judicial and extrajudicial litigation in this area;
  • manages relations and coordinates with APAC (Agenzia Provinciale degli Appalti e contratti, the regional agency for public procurement) to complete the procedures necessary for the purchase of works, goods and services managed by the Agency;
  • monitors legislation in the area of public procurement and drafts relevant guidelines to assist departments and centres, including through legal advice and assessments of the impact of procurement legislation on the organization;
  • oversees the University's obligations resulting from the University general guideline (atto di indirizzo) and the Stability Pact with the Autonomous Province of Trento as regards the University's involvement in achieving public finance objectives and the specific requirements of the Ministry of University and research;
  • provides advice on administrative, accounting and tax matters and support to the directors of departments and centres.

data.name: HR Development and Organization
data.description:
The HR Development and Organization Division is responsible for the evaluation of technical, administrative, and managerial staff, and for the definition of incentive policies.
It adheres to the management’s directives and keeps up with the University’s organizational developments.

The division identifies training requirements for technical and administrative staff, presents the training programme, and designs individual training actions.

In collaboration with the Human Resources and Organization Directorate, it closely monitors internal mobility of technical and administrative staff.

The division conducts surveys on the work environment and organizational well-being, and collects information on the quality of services offered by the University’s units. It participates in the drafting of the Three year plan of positive actions.

To conclude, it supervises the actions proposed in the framework on the Good Practice project, whose purpose is to improve the constant monitoring of performance within the participating universities and the University’s Family Audit certificate.

data.name: Support to the Evaluation Group
data.description:
This office provides organizational support to the Evaluation Group in managing the collection and statistical processing of data to carry out the evaluations required by legislation in force and by the University's Charter and regulations. This includes:

  • individual performances, organizational performance, the transparency and the anti-corruption performance
  • internal investigations on organizational well-being and customer satisfaction
  • the verification of requirements imposed by the self-assessment, accreditation and periodic evaluation system (AVA)
  • the distribution of teaching loads
  • the verification of requirements for the accreditation of doctoral programmes

data.name: CeRiN - Center for Neurocognitive Rehabilitation
data.address: Via M. del Ben, 5b, Rovereto, 38068 TN

data.name: Application Services Division - Administration, Interoperability and Platforms
data.description:
The division is responsible for the provision of services and assistance to all users affiliated with the University’s organizational units and governance bodies, both online and offline. It oversees and manages shared technological services in the main premises (rectorate, department buildings, Central University Library).

It is in charge of the analysis and development of middleware for software applications and provides the relevant support. It implements systems for the management and evolution of the ICT services access model (for logical and physical resources) through the Identity Management System and other services.

It cooperates with other divisions to ensure the adoption of shared practices and standards to access and use the services and to share internal, external and cloud information. Provides support in the implementation of access policies established by operational rules and procedures and in monitoring their efficacy.

It makes an assessment of requirements and finds possible solutions for the upgrade of services. It collects and publishes information, service quality benchmarks, statistical data, technical documents and manuals.

data.name: Application Services Division - Education, Research and Knowledge
data.description:
The division is responsible for the technological evolution of the University’s information systems, and the use of advanced technology for programming, application development and integration of platforms and services.

The division, in particular:

  • oversees and coordinates digitization processes and related work, to simplify and develop administrative procedures, and is committed to redesign document flows, increase the use of electronic signatures, adopt the standards and instruments available at a national level;
  • promotes measures to implement the “Codice dell’Amministrazione Digitale” (eGovernment Code), and ensures its support in the implementation of its provisions, guidelines and best practices;
  • works on the gradual development of a plan for the evolution of IT systems which focuses on the analysis of users’ needs in the areas of teaching, research, administrative and technical services, in line with the general objectives established by the University;
  • coordinates the development of information systems among different areas, promoting the sharing of the most efficient solutions and the dissemination of best practices;
  • oversees the life cycle of applications;
  • offers its services to develop applications, both through local platforms and through integration with external systems;
  • identifies the most appropriate instruments to satisfy the efficiency and functionality requirements for the development of information systems;
  • participates in the analysis of requirements providing decision-making support tools, and designs information systems that can be used to give an overview of University data in a coherent, correctly structured and clear way.
  • collaborates to user training initiatives on how to use the services and instruments it developed;
  • organizes support and coordination activities, in collaboration with the departments, to involve students in software development projects to supply services to users.

data.name: ICT Services Division
data.description:
The division provides users in departments and centers with assistance, support and training to access ICT services, and supervises local services; it ensures its support in the implementation of business continuity and security plans.

It provides technical assistance to the University Language Center and the Test Center, and ensures that the users of UniTrento have access to “Campus” software.

It also collects and publishes information, service quality benchmarks, statistical data, technical documents and manuals.
The division has specialized personnel providing services in the three University locations:

  • User Support - Trento
  • User Support - Povo-Mesiano
  • User Support - Rovereto

data.name: International Mobility Office - Social Sciences Area and Humanities
Education and Student Services coordination
data.description:
The division has a coordinating role between the director and the other divisions.

It serves as a liaison office among the three Education and Student Services Offices (of the Cognitive Science Area, the Humanities and Social Sciences Area, and the Science and Technology Area), and the offices responsible for student admissions to first and second level degree courses.

data.name: Postgraduate School – Postgraduate Specialisation for Legal Professions
Protocol, archive and postal services
data.description:
L'ufficio si occupa delle attività di protocollazione e gestione documentale:

  • protocollazione, gestione e smistamento della corrispondenza in arrivo, anche per via telematica, e coordinamento delle attività di protocollo in entrata svolte dai punti decentrati; 
  • supporto alle unità amministrative di Ateneo in relazione alle attività di protocollazione in uscita e di registrazione dei provvedimenti da esse compiute; 
  • gestione e sviluppo del sistema di protocollo informatico e gestione documentale PITre;
  • presidio delle comunicazioni attraverso i canali telematici disponibili: posta elettronica certificata (PEC) di Ateneo, interoperabilità semplificata, indirizzi di posta elettronica istituzionale di Ateneo. 

Per contattare l'ufficio in relazione al servizio di protocollazione, si prega di scrivere all'indirizzo uff.protocollocentrale@unitn.it 

È assegnata inoltre alla struttura la gestione del servizio postale interno. Per contattare l'ufficio in relazione al servizio postale interno, si prega di scrivere all'indirizzo serviziopostale@unitn.it

L'Ufficio si occupa, infine, del presidio degli strumenti archivistici (titolario di classificazione, manuale di gestione, massimario di scarto, ecc.), dell’implementazione delle procedure di aggiornamento dell’Albo di Ateneo, della gestione dell’Archivio di deposito di Ateneo e del servizio di conservazione digitale, nonché della tenuta dell’Archivio storico di Ateneo e del servizio di consultazione connesso.

data.name: Service Desk, Service Catalog and  ICT Training
Education and Student Services Management
data.description:
The Education and Student Services Management Directorate supports academic departments and centres in defining course content, oversees admissions and the academic progress of students of all levels, and is in charge of teacher training.

It offers orientation services for perspective students, organizes language courses, certifies skills and awards international certificates to enrolled students. It organizes and develops online teaching and learning tools.

It also serves as a liaison for the following divisions:

  • Education and Student Services coordination
  • Language Centre, Test Center and Digital Teaching Resources
  • Science and Technology Area - PhD Office
  • Humanities and Cognitive Science Area - PhD Office
  • General-Secretary Education and Student Services
  • Online Services and Technical Support
  • Teacher Training and Qualifications
  • Student Activities Office

data.name: Events, Branding and Graphic Design Division
data.description:
The Events, Branding and Graphic Projects Division ensures coordination among its offices, develops external and internal communication initiatives, defines communication strategies and tools to support Departments and Centres and organizational structures, and helps them in the design and implementation of events and promotion strategies.

The division is responsible for the brand and visual identity of the University, advertising campaigns, and for the design and implementation of communication tools for international recruitment, fundraising and research communication.

data.name: School of International Studies - SIS
data.description:
The School of International Studies (SIS) is a Centre established by the University of Trento to promote postgraduate research and education in the area of European and international studies. The departments of Economics and Management, Humanities, Sociology and Social Research, and the Faculty of Law participated in the creation of the school, which develops research and education programmes based on interdisciplinary approaches and skills to respond to the challenges of social, economic and institutional change resulting from globalization and European integration.

The School participates in several interdisciplinary research projects co-funded by external bodies. Three projects, co-funded by the Autonomous Province of Trento, focus on institutional change, economic growth and social development (with special attention for the European and Chinese areas). Two projects, funded by MIUR and the University, are centred on the relationship between globalization, climate change and the use of natural resources (water, in particular).

The School offers interdisciplinary education and specialization courses, entirely taught in English, to students who completed a three-year undergraduate degree, and is therefore the only “Graduate School” of International Studies in Italy. More precisely, the School organizes a Master's Degree in European and International Studies (Laura Magistrale in Studi Europei e Internazionali, MEIS), a Master's Degree in International Security Studies (Laura Magistrale in Studi sulla Sicurezza Internazionale - MISS) with Sant’Anna School of Advanced Studies in Pisa, and a three-year Doctoral programme in International Studies.

The School collaborates with national and international research centres and think-tanks and with the University’s departments and faculties. National and international academics are regularly invited to visit the School to give lectures and meet students. The School hosts weekly seminars on subjects pertaining to European and international studies and security, welcomes professional practitioners employed in important international organizations, promotes research conferences and workshops, organizes meetings to develop cross-sector skills (soft skills), contributes to the set up of the Summer school and to other dissemination events with other local, national and international research entities. Students, faculty members, post-doc researchers and visiting professors from all over the world take part in the School’s teaching and research activities.

The School of International Studies is honoured to have two distinguished Honorary Professors: Senator Giorgio Napolitano (former President of the Italian Republic) and Vaclav Klaus (former President of the Czech Republic).

data.name: Special Projects
data.description:
The division is responsible for the expansion and consolidation of the Alumni network.

It is responsible for the UNISPORT project, for its participation in national and international sport networks, the identification of new directions, its development and the documents that it may require. The division coordinates the relations with local and national sports organizations and clubs.

It maintains the relations with the University recreation club (CRU), and promotes and supports social innovation initiatives, including through multimedia channels.

It supports and manages student associations and their activities by providing support to the committee responsible for their evaluation.

It supports and identifies strategies and tools for fundraising.

data.name: Relations with employers and local organizations
data.description:
The division supports departments and centres in their relations with the world of work in order to develop and renew the programmes of study, organize training initiatives such as internships, apprenticeships, industrial doctorates, etc., and provide services that promote the employability of recent graduates of UniTrento.

In this context, the division promotes, manages and supports initiatives that provide students with skills and abilities that are in high demand on the labour market, and initiatives, in collaboration with the Directorate of Research Services and Valorization, aimed at developing a culture of work and entrepreneurship.

In collaboration with the Alumni network and with local and national employment services, the division also organizes and promotes work-related activities, job guidance counselling and provides information on trends in the labour market, job search and introduction to the world of work.

Finally, the division promotes the University's third mission activities and, in collaboration with the International Relations Division, contributes to its participation in national and international inter-university networks and consortia in this area.

data.name: Support to the Centro Studi Martino Martini
Monitoring, Statistics and Policy Development Unit
data.description:
The Monitoring, Statistics and Policy Development Unit performs studies that the University’s governing bodies need for strategic decision making and planning.

The Unit is responsible for the collection, consistency and coherence of data that it submits to the University's internal and external stakeholders through the statistical office, the University website and specific analyses.

It is responsible for activities connected with statistical analyses required by the Ministry of Education, Italian National Institute of Statistics, Almalaurea annual surveys about students' features and employment condition, national and international rankings and the municipalities of Trento and Rovereto.

It oversees all activities carried out for the National register of students on undergraduate and postgraduate degree programmes.

The unit takes great care in preparing detailed documents whose purpose is to assess and account for the University's achievements in a number of important areas, in particular as regards the allocation of funds to departments and centres, the approval of salary increases for academic staff every three years, the evaluation of teaching objectives, and student career progress.

As part of its main activities in the area of education, the unit collects information and data for the Evaluation Committee and monitors quality for the Quality Assurance Committee.

In accordance with the Quality Assurance Committee, it organizes and processes the statistical data emerging from the evaluation of quality of teaching activities by students. It works with other offices on customer satisfaction surveys on University services. It prepares the statistical analyses required for the drawing up of the Integrated Plan and the data processing required for gender studies for the Committee for Equal Opportunities.

data.name: Centre of Security and Crime Sciences
Office of the Directorate of Communication and External Relations
Research Staff Recruitment Office
data.description: L’ufficio si occupa dell’attivazione e della gestione delle procedure di selezione del personale di ricerca (assegni di ricerca, collaborazioni alla ricerca, borse di studio).

data.name: Research Management Division
data.description:
In collaboration with the Research Support Division and with the administrative and accounting offices of departments and centres, the Division provides consultancy and administrative support for the development of research activities, the management of research, cultural cooperation and international mobility projects, and the selection of research staff.

In particular, the Division provides support in all the phases of the management of funded research projects ranging from initiation to management, to the selection of research staff, monitoring, reporting and audit procedures. In addition, the Division supports the valorization of University technological platforms and research laboratories.

In collaboration with the Research Support  and the Research Valorisation and Impact Divisions and in coordination with the administrative and accounting offices and departments, the Division deals with the stipulation and revision of national and international agreements, contracts and conventions aimed at carrying out both institutional and commercial research activities.

data.name: Scientific Publications Office
data.description: L’ufficio fornisce consulenza e supporto amministrativo ai dipartimenti e centri di Ateneo nelle procedure di avvio di nuove iniziative editoriali (riviste e collane) per la casa editrice Università degli Studi di Trento. Si occupa inoltre di fornire supporto alle redazioni editoriali delle riviste e delle collane di Ateneo per le attività correlate alla pubblicazione di opere scientifiche in formato sia cartaceo che digitale e per la loro promozione e disseminazione ad accesso aperto.

data.name: Digital services for research office
data.description:
L’ufficio si occupa dell’ideazione e della gestione di servizi digitali orientati alla promozione, alla valorizzazione e al monitoraggio della ricerca, con particolare riferimento alla produzione scientifica, agli esperti e alle competenze di Ateneo. Questa missione è in linea e in continuità con l’iniziativa Digital University e viene perseguita in collaborazione con la Direzione Servizi Digitali e Bibliotecari e con la Direzione Comunicazione e Relazioni Esterne.

L’analisi dei processi organizzativi e gestionali nei diversi contesti applicativi in cui si genera e transita l’informazione costituisce un mezzo attraverso il quale l’ufficio propone soluzioni - che possono includere la ridefinizione dei processi - mirate al progressivo miglioramento della qualità dei dati e dei servizi offerti.

data.name: Division for the Valorization and Impact of Research
data.description:
The Division provides support in the area of protection and valorization of intellectual and industrial property, technology transfer and creation of university startups. For this reason, it collaborates with the Intellectual property rights committee and implements its decisions.

In order to maximise the impact of university research and in collaboration with the Research Management Division and the Research Support Division it promotes and provides support for participation in national and international calls and programmes through the drafting of collaboration agreements for joint research projects, partnerships, collaboration contracts, confidentiality agreements and third party contracts. The Division also coordinates and manages relations with local bodies and foundations within its competence.

data.name: Research Support Office
data.description:
Through its three on-campus units (in Trento, Povo-Mesiano, and Rovereto), the office helps researchers find funding opportunities and disseminates information on calls for proposals and training activities in the area of research and innovation.

The office promotes the participation in national, European and international calls for funding by providing assistance with the interpretation of management and accounting regulations. It also defines guidelines and procedures on how to participate in research programmes and calls for funding.

The office manages the database of the University’s research projects (anagrafica progetti) and provides support with contracts with funding organizations and accounting and audit procedures.

data.name: Rector
data.description: The Rector guarantees that there is a common strategic policy among the governing bodies of the University and promotes and coordinates scientific and teaching activities. The Rector is the legal representative of the University.

data.name: Sports council
data.description: The sports council oversees all sports initiatives and activities that are organised by the University and the Trento University Sports Centre.

data.name: CIBIO - Council
data.description:
The Council of the Department is the main governing body of the Department.
It comprises all the professors of the Department and representatives of students, detailed below, PhD students, research fellows and researchers, in accordance with the procedures defined in the Department regulation.

data.name: Consiglio del Centro Interdipartimentale in Scienze Mediche - CISMed
Patent commission
data.description: The commission is appointed to take decisions regarding the management of the patent portfolio of the University and to define the policies concerning the protection of the industrial p

data.name: Consiglio del Centro Agricoltura, Alimenti, Ambiente - C3A
CeRiN Administrative Services
data.address: Via M. del Ben, 5b, Rovereto, 38068 TN

data.name: Committee for Equal Opportunities, Well-being at Work and Against Discriminations (CUG)
data.description: The Supervisory Committee aims at promoting and protecting equal opportunities and wellbeing and the quality of working time and of the organization, for all the staff of the University, including the non-permanent staff.

data.name: Institutional Relations Office supporting the Rector, the President of the Board of Directors and the Director General
data.description:
The Institutional Relations Office supporting the Rector, the President of the Board of Directors and the Director General:

  • assists the Rector and Vice Rectors, the President of the Board of Directors and the Director General in carrying out their institutional activities.
  • Collaborates with the University's leadership for the management, maintenance and development of institutional relationships, strategic partnerships, and initiatives that require special attention.
  • Collaborates with departments and centres in the organization of events that include the participation of the University's top management, coordinates the organization of institutional ceremonies, and is responsible for ceremonial aspects.
  • Manages the budget and the goods and services requirements of departments, centres and other offices.

data.name: Director General support and document drafting
Student Support Service - Science and technology area - Mesiano
Industrial Engineering - Department Council
data.description:
The Council of the Department is the main governing body of the Department.
It comprises all the professors of the Department and representatives of students, detailed below, PhD students, research fellows and researchers, in accordance with the procedures defined in the Department regulation.

data.name: Faculty of Law - Department Council
data.description:
The Council of the Faculty is the main governing body of the Faculty.
It comprises all the professors of the Faculty and representatives of students, detailed below, PhD students, research fellows and researchers, in accordance with the procedures defined in the Faculty regulation.

data.name: Economics and Management - Department Council
data.description:
The Council of the Department is the main governing body of the Department.
It comprises all the professors of the Department and representatives of students, detailed below, PhD students, research fellows and researchers, in accordance with the procedures defined in the Department regulation.

data.name: Information Engineering and Computer Science - Technical Support
Administrative Services for Teaching and Research Activities - Trento
Administration and Accounting Services - Rovereto
data.description:
The Administration and Accounting Service for Rovereto offers its services to the departments and centers based in Rovereto.
The service:

  • supports the Planning Division, in collaboration with the directors of departments and centers, in planning and programming activities for the relevant units
  • is responsible for (general/analytic, vendors/clients) accounting for its units, including all that is required for drawing up the balance sheet (amendments and corrections included)
  • serves as a liaison office for the Administration Division for tax requirements and support to external auditors
  • manages supply procedures and contracts below the EU threshold
  • issues invoices and monitors credits
  • manages cash reserves for the relevant units
  • is responsible for paying suppliers of goods and services, reimbursing expenses for missions, other compensations
  • supports research and scientific collaborations
  • supports teaching and research staff in accounting matters, contracts, various procedures
  • provides its support in selection procedures in the areas of teaching and research and oversees contracts in collaboration with the Human Resources and Organization Directorate
  • drafts and organizes contracts

data.name: Administration and Accounting Services - Trento
data.description:
The Administration and Accounting Service for Trento offers its services to the departments and centers based in Trento.
The service:

  • supports the Planning Division, in collaboration with the directors of departments and centers, in planning and programming activities for the relevant units
  • is responsible for (general/analytic, vendors/clients) accounting for its units, including all that is required for drawing up the balance sheet (amendments and corrections included)
  • serves as a liaison office for the Administration Division for tax requirements and support to external auditors
  • manages supply procedures and contracts below the EU threshold
  • issues invoices and monitors credits
  • manages cash reserves for the relevant units
  • is responsible for paying suppliers of goods and services, reimbursing expenses for missions, other compensations
  • supports research and scientific collaborations
  • supports teaching and research staff in accounting matters, contracts, procedures
  • provides its support in selection procedures in the areas of teaching and research and oversees contracts in collaboration with the Human Resources and Organization Directorate
  • drafts and organizes contracts

data.name: Quality Committee
data.description: The Quality Assurance Committee is responsible for the implementation of quality assurance procedures at University level, within courses of study and in the departments, based on the guidelines established by the governing bodies.

data.name: Joint Committee for the Right to Study and the Valorization of Merit
data.description: The joint committee for the right to study and the promotion of merit expresses obligatory opinion to the Academic Senate as regards the system of student contribution, the policies of promotion of merit, and the measures for the right to study; it makes proposals to the Academic Senate about international mobility and services to the students; it monitors initiatives taken in these areas.

data.name: Student Support Service: Humanities and Social Sciences
Civil, Environmental and Mechanical Engineering - Laboratory Technicians
Sociology and Social Research - Technical Support
Psychology and Cognitive Science - Laboratory Technicians
data.address: Via M. del Ben, 5b, Rovereto, 38068 TN

data.name: Psychology and Cognitive science - Department Staff
Centre for Integrative Biology - Laboratory Technicians
Language Centre, Test Center and Digital Teaching Resources
data.description:
In collaboration with departments and centres, it designs and organizes language courses (both in-class and online) for all university students, students participating in international mobility programmes and University staff. It organizes the language tests that students must pass to participate in training and mobility programmes.

It coordinates distance learning and training programmes and online evaluations, and oversees some administrative and practical aspects of the activities organized by the University Test Center.

data.name: Development of Online Services and User Support
Humanities and Cognitive Science Area - PhD Office
data.description:
The division supports the work of academic departments and centres of the humanities and cognitive science area, in particular as regards:

  • writing proposals to establish and renew doctoral courses, annual reports, courses regulations, and maintaining relationships with institutional partners;
  • establishing collaboration and funding agreements to offer study courses;
  • preparing calls for admissions, managing applications online, dealing with selection procedures;
  • improving the international appeal of the doctoral programme and increasing student mobility through agreements for joint thesis research, international mobility programmes, support to foreign students/PhD students, support to evaluation committees that have to assess foreign qualifications;
  • accounting procedures in compliance with national regulations, elaboration and analysis of statistical data.

The division also oversees the academic progress of PhD students up to their thesis defense, and is responsible for other qualifying exams (esami di Stato) that the University offers.
The division is also responsible for the services that the two areas have in common (as concerns doctoral courses and advanced training): preparing the budget for PhD grants, aids, increases; accounting procedures connected to benefits; accounting procedures for tax purposes.

data.name: Education and Student Services - Humanities and Social Sciences Area
data.description:
Through its subunits, the office defines the university courses for departments and centres, oversees students matters for first and second level courses (admissions, careers, exam certificates, graduations), is responsible for quality assurance, the publication of notices on Esse3, lecture arrangements.

The office also oversees international mobility programmes, helping foreign students and PhD students on their arrival and during their stay, it drafts international mobility agreements and takes part in negotiations for this purpose, publishes calls and designates the members of selection committees. It participates in international promotion campaigns.

data.name: Board of Directors
data.description: The Board of Directors is the body that governs and is responsible for the general organisation of the University. It oversees the economic and financial management of the University as well as that of its assets.

data.name: Evaluation Group
data.description: The Evaluation Group continuously and systematically checks the performance of the University in its organization, in the research and teaching activities, and determines the overall quality of the procedures, thereby contributing to the improvement of the internal system of self-evaluation and to the promotion of merit. The Group, in complete autonomy, draws up an annual report on the attainment of the strategic plan and on the achievement of the rigorous objectives, and submits this report to the Council of Administration by May of each year.

data.name: Science Libraries (Science, Engineering, Cognitive Science)
data.description: The Science Libraries Division performs research work and bibliographic searches to develop the collections, organizes spaces and activities at the libraries of Engineering, Science and Cognitive Science, coordinates and manages user services: borrowing on site, provincial interlibrary loan, reference service, training on the library’s resources and services.

data.name: BUC - Central University Library
data.description: The Central University Library (BUC) Division performs research work and bibliographical checks to develop the collections, organizes the library’s spaces and activities, coordinates and manages user services: borrowing on site, provincial, national and international interlibrary loan, reference service, training on the library’s resources and services.

data.name: Recruitment and Relations with Trade Unions
Employee Relations and Payroll Division - Technical and Administrative Staff
data.description:
The Employee Relations and Payroll Division - Technical and Administrative Staff manages administrative procedures relating to technical and administrative staff and Language experts.

The division ensures the proper implementation of labour law, the national collective agreement, the University Collective Agreement and other decentralized agreements (on matters like trial periods, permits, leaves of absence, parental leave, sick leave, mobility, part-time work, study permits), and drafts regulations, directives and explanatory notes in its areas of competence.

The division prepares staff salaries and is responsible for procedures concerning tax reports, insurances, social security. In these matters, it implements social security and remuneration legislation.

The division oversees the administrative implications of fringe benefits granted to employees.

data.name: Office of the Directorate of IT and Library Services
Directorate of IT and Library Services
data.description:
La Direzione Servizi Digitali e Bibliotecari si occupa di: 

  • attuazione dei programmi deliberati dagli organi accademici e delle direttive del Direttore Generale, attraverso la gestione finanziaria, tecnica e amministrativa delle risorse umane, strumentali e di controllo direttamente attribuite per garantire un costante sviluppo e miglioramento della componente tecnologica dei sistemi informativi, dell’accesso ad applicazioni, informazioni e servizi da parte degli utenti e l’acquisizione ed utilizzo efficace ed efficiente di infrastrutture e tecnologie ICT per lo svolgimento delle funzioni proprie dell’ateneo;  
  • coordinamento e verifica delle aree di servizio presidiate dai poli e facilitazione dell’integrazione con l’attività delle altre direzioni;
  • supporto, alla luce dei bisogni di servizi ICT delle strutture, nell’elaborazione di piani e programmi anche pluriennali generali e/o specifici dell’area;
  • elaborazione periodica di consuntivi circa i risultati conseguiti in termini di efficienza nell'impiego delle risorse e di efficacia nella gestione in relazione agli obiettivi prefissati; 
  • elaborazione dei piani e programmi di sviluppo del Sistema Bibliotecario di Ateneo; 
  • rendicontazione periodica sullo stato del Sistema Bibliotecario di Ateneo;
  • predisposizione e trasmissione all’Ufficio Studi dei dati di competenza per la diffusione ad organi esterni (MIUR, Nucleo di Valutazione, ecc.);
  • raccolta dati statistici e indicatori statistici;
  • gestione dei sistemi U-Gov IRIS e UNITN-eprints.

data.name: Diversity Management
data.description:
• Assists the Vice Rector for equality and diversity policies in the management and development of institutional relations and in carrying out their functions;
  • promotes good practices to manage diversity;
  • assists and coordinates the departments' delegates on equality policies;
  • provides organizational support to the Committee for equal opportunities;
  • provides assistance to the working table including all bodies engaged in anti-discrimination policies (for example: the Committee for equal opportunities, the Vice Rector for equality and diversity policies, the Rector’s delegate for Organizational well-being, the Confidential counsellor, the Committee for the implementation of the Code of Ethics);
  • serves as a support and liaison office for working groups in the area of equality and diversity: for example the working group on ethnic differences, the working group on disabilities, the working group on work-life balance;
  • liaises with the Human Resources and Organization Directorate in the design of work-life balance policies.

data.name: Information services in support of academic activities
Infrastructure, Collaboration and ICT Security Services Division
data.description:
The division designs, oversees and manages the infrastructure of technological services of the University: Network, Data Center, Audio and Video technology, Mail and Collaboration software. It makes an assessment of requirements, finds possible solutions and options for their upgrade.

It supports the implementation of business continuity and ICT security plans: it is in charge of the CERT service (overseeing policies and procedures in matters of security, risk assessment, incident and escalation management) and of the on-call service.

It also collects and publishes information, service quality benchmarks, statistical data, technical documents and manuals.

data.name: International Mobility Office - Science and technology area
International Relations
data.description:
The International Relations Division, in synergy with the departments and centres and the organizational units, supports the Vice Rectors and Rector's Delegates for internationalization in the identification and management of actions aimed at developing the international dimension and positioning of the University.

It also supports departments and centres in participating in international actions promoted by Ministries, institutions and other public and private organizations at European and international level, and defines (bilateral, multilateral, double degree) collaboration agreements with foreign universities and institutions.

It collaborates with the Directorate of Education and Student Services for student mobility, and manages the mobility of academic and administrative -technical staff in the framework of international exchange programmes.

The division is in charge of international inter-university networks and consortia in collaboration with the Division for Relations with employers and local organizations, and supports the Jean Monnet Centre in the planning, implementation and reporting of activities.

Finally, it is responsible for the University's communication in the context of international activities (creation of advertising material, dissemination of data at the university level, management of the International website, creation of documentation for the University's governing bodies).

data.name: Contracts and Procurement Division
data.description:
The Contracts and Procurement Division supports all University offices in preparing the documents for tender procedures or the award of contracts for the supply of goods and services.
It is responsible for procedures open to public scrutiny for public procurement of works, supplies and services above EU threshold.
Supports the project manager in all public tendering procedures for the award of public work contracts.

The Contracts and Procurement Division supervises the procedures for the purchase of goods and services below the EU threshold for the University’s divisions, including through e-procurement and online tender procedures.

It prepares and signs contracts for the outsourcing of services below the EU threshold and supervises the procedures leading to open contracts/framework agreements below EU threshold for consumer goods.

data.name: Buildings Managementand Maintenance Division
data.description:
Among the responsibilities of the Buildings Managementand Maintenance Division are routine and non-routine maintenance services, the University’s energy saving policy, contracts for planned maintenance, the management of urban services, the on-call service.

The division also oversees the correct implementation of internal safety rules and procedures in all University premises, in collaboration with Environmental and safety services. 

It maintains the archive of as built plans and all the declarations of conformity under law 46/99.

data.name: Administration and Accounting Office - Estates Directorate
Circolo Ricreativo Università - CRU (University Recreation Centre)
Center for Mind/Brain Sciences - CIMeC
data.description:
The research areas at the Center for Mind/Brain Sciences - CIMeC span from experimental psychology and neuroimaging acquisition methods to cognitive neurosciences and animal cognition to computational linguistics. The Centre is composed of the departments of Psychology and Cognitive science, Humanities, Mathematics, Physics, Information engineering and computer science.

The Centre offers a Master’s degree and a PhD course which give students excellent employment opportunities once they have completed their studies, and this is possible thanks to a strong empirical approach at all levels.

CIMeC has been recently ranked as the leading research unit in Cognitive neuroscience in Italy.

data.name: Center for Neuroscience and Cognitive Systems@UniTn, Italian Institute of Technology, Rovereto, Italy
Directorate of Communication and External Relations
data.description:
The Directorate of Communication and External Relations oversees initiatives aimed at promoting the University, highlighting in particular its international dimension and relations with external organizations and employers.

The directorate, in particular:

  • promotes the University by strengthening and widening its participation in national and international networks and projects
  • develops and monitors the University's relationships with other organizations
  • manages political information from the governing bodies to the media
  • manages actions aimed at the development of the University's international relations
  • defines the communication plans and manages the initiatives they contain
  • works for the development of web and social media communication
  • develops event promotion and branding campaigns for the University as a whole and its departments and centres
  • organizes scientific dissemination events
  • provides support to identify new communication initiatives and tools for fundraising and for the recruitment of international students
  • develops relations between the University and employers, in collaboration with academic departments and centres
  • manages initiatives that bring together students, graduates and employers
  • manages projects to support and develop university sport
  • supports associations and groups and manages activities designed for them
  • manages activities aimed at widening and consolidating the Alumni network, and at supporting Alumni associations and groups

The Directorate of Communication and External Relations includes the following offices and divisions:

  • International student recruitment
  • Press Office and External Relations
  • Web and Social Media Office
  • Events, Branding and Graphic Projects Division
  • Relations with employers and local organizations
  • International Relations Division
  • Special projects
